definition: A term used to describe individuals who share a common ancestry or familial connection, typically referring to relatives or kinship ties. It is commonly used to denote family members, such as parents, siblings, aunts, uncles, cousins, and other blood relations.

examples.german: Ich habe viele Verwandte in Deutschland.
examples.english: I have many relatives in Germany.
My relatives are coming to visit.
We are all related to each other.

examples.german: Er hat viele Verwandte im Ausland.
